summary: This bill, the Requiring Excise for Migrant Income Transfers Act (REMIT Act), proposes an excise tax of 15% on remittance transfers. It includes exceptions for transfers by U.S. citizens/nationals through qualified providers, along with provisions for a refundable tax credit for U.S. citizens/nationals who pay the tax. The bill also mandates reporting requirements for remittance transfer providers and makes conforming amendments to the Internal Revenue Code and Title 31 of the United States Code. The key aim is to generate revenue from international money transfers.
